examples: Sarah believes that people are inherently good, and that if you approach them with kindness and trust, they will reciprocate - she truly embodies the idea that to the pure all things are pure.
Back in the day, Forever 21 embodied the American dream.
The bags embody absolute luxury.
- Embody the spirit of the gamer.
The threat of cannibalism is embodied by the Windigo.
words.defineEn: represent, as of a character on stage
words.defineVi: đại diện, như một nhân vật trên sân khấu

words.defineEn: possessing or existing in bodily form
words.defineVi: sở hữu hoặc tồn tại ở dạng cơ thể

examples: These were cars that previously had been the embodiment of the boring vehicles.
The campus was designed and founded in 1819 by Thomas Jefferson, drafter of the Declaration of Independence and slave owner, the embodiment of the contradictions of U.S. history.
Florence Owens Thompson became a legend of the strength of motherhood and to so many people then, and to many more today, she is the embodiment of that legend.
You are pale, you have to - you look like the human embodiment of Utah.
Thjalfi couldn’t outrun Hugi because Hugi was the embodiment of thought, always faster than action.
words.defineEn: a new personification of a familiar idea
words.defineVi: một hiện thân mới của một ý tưởng quen thuộc

examples: Take this inhospitable bog, where pitcher plants reign supreme.
As he told it, the Martian landscape had become inhospitable, and the Martians had built the canals to bring water from the ice caps down to the equator.
Some, in fact, can live in places that are totally inhospitable to humans and most other animals.
So it's constantly being bombarded by with ultraviolet radiation from the Sun, which is very inhospitable to DNA and to life.
The oceans would have been inhospitable to most animal life today, because they were very low in oxygen but really high in sulfur.
words.defineEn: a place or environment that is not welcoming or suitable for living or staying in, often due to harsh or unfavorable conditions that make survival or thriving challenging
words.defineVi: một địa điểm hoặc môi trường không chào đón hoặc không thích hợp để sống hoặc ở, thường là do điều kiện khắc nghiệt hoặc không thuận lợi khiến việc sinh tồn hoặc phát triển trở nên khó khăn

examples: Tiananmen Square, Beijing, the largest public spacein the world, created on an inhuman scale.
It was then that I saw her wild, inhuman face!
There was a strange, inhuman sound, then I heard a door shut upstairs on the top floor.

And that consistent, long-term imagining of Jewish people as evil or inferior or inhuman allowed the horrors of the Holocaust to happen unchecked, and kept Jewish people from the safe harbor they might otherwise have found.
There’s Pierre, a nerd of inhuman strength who comes into wealth and nobility by circumstance, and angsts about how to use these resources ethically and find personal happiness.
words.defineEn: lacking compassion, empathy, or any qualities traditionally associated with human beings
words.defineVi: thiếu lòng trắc ẩn, sự đồng cảm hoặc bất kỳ phẩm chất nào theo truyền thống gắn liền với con người

words.defineEn: gain favor with somebody by deliberate efforts
words.defineVi: giành được sự ưu ái với ai đó bằng những nỗ lực có chủ ý

words.defineEn: a person who shows no gratitude
words.defineVi: một người không thể hiện lòng biết ơn

examples: - In 1619, the English privateer ship, white lion landed at Point Comfort in Virginia.
It’s been recorded as early as 1598, when the poet Lope De Vega recounted how it helped thwart a surprise attack by the English privateer Sir Francis Drake.
words.defineEn: a privately owned warship commissioned to prey on the commercial shipping or warships of an enemy nation
words.defineVi: một tàu chiến thuộc sở hữu tư nhân được giao nhiệm vụ làm mồi cho tàu thương mại hoặc tàu chiến của một quốc gia thù địch

examples: Along that desperate and dangerous journey, Nadja and Bruno met migrants from Latin America, Africa, the Middle East and South Asia, most fleeing privation, conflict, political persecution, or a combination of all three, and one group in particular, men from Bangladesh.
words.defineEn: act of depriving someone of food or money or rights
words.defineVi: hành động tước đoạt thực phẩm hoặc tiền bạc hoặc quyền của ai đó

examples: We are not privy to the results.
I wasn’t privy to that.
I’m not privy to what they were there.
Up until the 2008 financial crisis, lawmakers were under few restrictions and the public wasn't privy to much.
Because these are ones that I am just privy to.
words.defineEn: (followed by `to') informed about something secret or not generally known
words.defineVi: (theo sau là `to') thông báo về điều gì đó bí mật hoặc không được biết đến rộng rãi

examples: Anyway, even as he’s sleeping around, Odysseus is incredibly concerned with whether or not Penelope is chaste.
So most bananas live a chaste life: if you’re a banana farmer, you get more banana plants by cutting off a piece of the stem of an existing banana plant, and sticking it in the ground.
words.defineEn: morally pure (especially not having experienced sexual intercourse)
words.defineVi: trong sạch về mặt đạo đức (đặc biệt là chưa từng quan hệ tình dục)

examples: In general they were just much less obsessed with female chastity than Europeans were.
That's pretty impressive, considering the chastity is almost identical.
The boys gonna wear a chastity belt, I'm telling you,.
Not only was it thought to be more hygienic to have a layer between the genitals and outer clothes, but also disguising the shape of the genitals was believed to promote modesty and chastity.
The pre-colonial Filipino cultures didn’t put a particular value on chastity for any gender, although extramarital relationships were seen as improper only for women.
words.defineEn: abstaining from sexual relations (as because of religious vows)
words.defineVi: kiêng quan hệ tình dục (như vì lời thề tôn giáo)

examples: So once I had realized that I'd never said the word out loud to my 10 year old, I chastised myself for a moment on that.
Because as much as we all love to chastise these acts as musical frivolity, I can’t help but wonder if the heat would be quite so hot if the bands had a mixed or primarily male audience base.
words.defineVi: chỉ trích nặng nề hoặc la mắng

examples: We sprinkled chervil over our roasted vegetables, elevating their taste with a hint of herbaceous goodness.
The chef recommended adding cilantro to the marinade for a bright and herbaceous flavor.
It’s the vivid fruit of an African herbaceous plant, and back in 2012, it was heralded as the most intense natural color on the planet.
words.defineEn: characteristic of a nonwoody herb or plant part
words.defineVi: đặc tính của một loại thảo mộc không thân gỗ hoặc một phần thực vật

words.defineEn: a collection of dried plants that are mounted and systematically classified for study
words.defineVi: một bộ sưu tập thực vật khô được gắn kết và phân loại một cách có hệ thống để nghiên cứu

examples: Nodosaurs belonged to a larger group of herbivorous dinosaurs called the ankylosaurs.
As time wore on, Arctotherium bears got smaller, and their food habits became more herbivorous.
Hadrosaurs are herbivorous dinosaurs, as we’ve known for a long time from their teeth, skulls, and even gut contents.
Their skulls looked a lot more like those of mostly herbivorous bears, like the giant panda and the spectacled bear.
This rotund, barrel-like belly is on full display in the early herbivorous pelycosaur Cotylorhynchus, whose body dwarfed its tiny head.

words.defineEn: causing or displaying great sadness or distress
words.defineVi: gây ra hoặc hiển thị nỗi buồn lớn hoặc đau khổ
